alert.note: Alert for Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Above 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft; Walsenburg Vicinity, Upper Huerfano River Basin Below 7500 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 11:59AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Huerfano, northeastern Costilla and western Las Animas Counties through 1230 PM MDT... At 1157 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm over Cuchara, or near Indian Creek on the southeastern Spring Burn Scar, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Brief heavy rainfall and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Huerfano county and Indian Creek on the southeastern Spring Burn Scar around 1205 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
